name: Game Modes & Creature Control
description:
Game Modes & Creature Control

Choose one of two ways to play:

Game Master Mode

One player acts as the Game Master (GM), controlling all creatures and bringing the world to life. In this mode, the GM can improvise encounters and does not have to follow a specific Adventure Scenario, though they can use them as a guideline for inspiration.

Competitive Cooperative Mode

In this mode, players must follow the chosen Adventure Scenario. All players are on the same team against the scenario, but personal glory has its rewards. During a Timed Scene, players take turns controlling the creatures.

When controlling creatures, your goal is to challenge the other heroes to earn Antagonist Tokens for yourself:

  • Earn 1 XP: Deal damage to any hireling OR successfully apply a Condition to another player's hero.
  • Earn 2 XP:: Deal damage to another player's hero with an attack.
  • Earn 3 XP: Reduce another player's hero to 0 HP.

name: Initiative & Turns
description:
Turn Order

Timed Scenes use an alternating turn structure. The round begins with the players.

  1. The first turn is a Player Turn.
  2. The second turn is an Enemy Turn.
  3. Turns continue to alternate (Player, Enemy, Player, Enemy...) until all participants have acted once.

Player Turns

On a player turn, the players as a group decide which hero acts. Each hero can only act once per round. If the players cannot agree, each player who has not yet acted rolls 1d20; the highest roller must act.

Enemy Turns

On an enemy turn, the person controlling the creatures (the GM or a player in co-op mode) chooses which creature acts. Each creature can only act once per round.

End of the Round

Once every hero and creature has taken a turn, the round ends. A new round begins, starting again with a Player Turn.

name: Timed Scenes: Setup & The Grid
description:
Setting Up a Timed Scene

A **Timed Scene** begins when a card instructs you to. It is played on a grid, integrating all forms of conflict. **Setup is dictated by the Adventure Scenario and Location Card, or by the Game Master in GM mode.**

  1. Find the Location Card: This card provides the map size and features.
  2. Place Miniatures: The Scenario Card tells you which creatures to place and their starting coordinates (e.g., "Orc Grunt at A5"). Place heroes in their designated starting area.
  3. **Determine Objective:** The initiating Adventure card sets the scene's goal.
  4. **Begin:** Start the first round with a Player Turn.

name: The Adventure Loop (Core Rules)
description:
The Core Game Loop

Gameplay progresses in episodic, self-contained units. This structure must be followed in Competitive Cooperative mode and serves as a guideline for the Game Master.

  1. **Choose Adventure:** The party selects an **Adventure Scenario** card.
  2. **Play Scenes:** The Adventure card directs the party through a sequence of **Location Cards** (Scenes).
  3. **Timed Scenes:** Any significant conflict is resolved as a **Timed Scene** on the grid.
  4. **End Adventure & Rewards:** Upon achieving the final objective, the party gains the fixed **XP** and **Gold** dictated by the Scenario's **Difficulty Rating** (F to S++).
  5. **Downtime Phase:** Proceed to the **Progression & Downtime** rules to spend rewards and modify decks before selecting a new adventure.

name: Scenario Rules & Difficulty
description:
Scenario Structure & Progression

A Session of play is defined by completing a single Scenario Card. Between sessions, players acquire rewards (Gold/XP) and manage their decks.

Difficulty Rating (F to S++)

  • F-Rank: Tutorial / Single-Scene Encounter.
  • C-Rank: Entry-Level Adventure (3-4 Scenes, Minor Hazard/Enemies).
  • B-Rank: Standard Adventure (4-5 Scenes, Standard Boss).
  • A-Rank: Heroic Adventure (5+ Scenes, Multiple Bosses).
  • S++ Rank: Legendary / Campaign-Defining Event.

Post-Session Phase

  • Gold: Used for purchasing Treasure Boosters and Hirelings.
  • XP: Used for purchasing Hero Boosters and new Feature Cards.

name: Grid & Miniatures
description:
Grid & Miniatures

All **Timed Scenes** are played on a grid using creature miniatures.

  • **Square:** The basic unit of movement and distance (approx. 5 feet/1.5 meters).
  • **Positioning:** A miniature occupies a single square on the grid.
  • **Distance & Range:** All ranges (Melee, Ranged, Abilities) are measured in squares.

name: Roll Results
description:
Roll Results

Roll 1d20 + modifier.

  • **16+ (High Hit):** Succeed with a bonus.
  • **9-15 (Medium Hit):** Succeed, but with a cost or lesser effect.
  • **1-8 (Low Hit):** Fail, and face a new complication.

**Advantage:** Roll twice, take the highest. **Disadvantage:** Roll twice, take the lowest.

name: Conditions
description:
Conditions

Negative effects that last until removed or their duration expires.

  • **Blinded:** Disadvantage on sight actions. Attacks against you have advantage.
  • **Charmed:** Cannot attack the charmer.
  • **Confused:** Roll d6 on turn: 1-2 do nothing, 3-4 attack nearest, 5-6 act normally.
  • **Deafened:** Fail actions that require hearing.
  • **Frightened:** Disadvantage on all actions while source of fear is visible.
  • **Immobilized:** SPEED is 0. Cannot be moved.
  • **Poisoned:** Take damage at the start of your turn.
  • **Stunned:** Cannot take actions or reactions.
  • **Taunted:** Must attack the creature that taunted you.
  • **Weakened:** Disadvantage on your next roll.

name: Resource Depletion & Defeat
description:
Resource Depletion & Defeat

In any scene, reaching 0 in a resource has an immediate effect:

  • **HP 0 (Character):** Trigger **Last Breath** (Roll+COS).
  • **HP 0 (Creature):** Creature is **Defeated** and removed from the scene.
  • **MP 0 (Character/Creature):** Cannot use abilities that require an MP cost.
  • **SP 0 (Character/Creature):** Cannot use abilities that require an SP cost (such as **Parley** or **Cutting Words**). They are defeated in the conflict and cannot influence its outcome through non-physical means.

name: Character Creation & Decks
description:
Character Decks

Create a character by opening one **Hero Booster** and one **Treasure Booster** to form your starting deck.

  • **Active Deck:** Your current character's cards. If your character dies, this deck is lost.
  • **Side Deck:** All other cards you own. Use these to build a new character after death.

name: Deckbuilding Rules
description:
Deckbuilding Rules

An Active Deck must follow these limits:

  • **Unique Cards (Limit 1 of each type):** Personality, Culture, Species, Background, Family, Friends, Enemies, Drawback, Destiny.
  • **Standard Cards (No limit):** Features, Trainings, Items, Hirelings.

name: Crystals & Attunement
description:
Crystals & Attunement

Cards in your deck `provide` crystals to your character's **Crystal Pool**.

During the **Downtime Phase**, you may `devote` crystals from your pool to cards that `require` them, unlocking their abilities.

name: Downtime: Marketplace & Advancement
description:
Downtime: Marketplace & Advancement

During the Downtime Phase between adventures, you can spend your hard-earned rewards to improve your deck and prepare for the next challenge. These activities can be performed in any order and are not limited to a single choice.

Purchasing Booster Packs

  • Hero Booster Pack (5 XP): Gain new Feature and Training cards to advance your character.
  • Treasure Booster Pack (100 Gold): Acquire new Item and Hireling cards.
  • Monster Booster Pack (75 Gold): Add creature cards to your collection.

Monster Card Rules

Creatures from Monster Booster Packs are added to your Side Deck and have unique uses:

  • Prospective Hirelings: A monster you own is considered 'defeated' for the purpose of any card effect that allows you to recruit a defeated creature as a hireling.
  • Other Uses: Certain Feature cards may allow you to use your owned monster cards in other ways, such as summoning them to fight alongside you.

Selling Your Wares

You can sell any of your unwanted Item cards to gain Gold. The standard rate is half of the item's listed Gold value. If no value is listed, you gain 5 Gold.

description:

name: Turn & Movement
description:
Turn & Movement

On your turn in a **Timed Scene**, you have **two Actions** (any mix of abilities or movement) and **one Reaction**.

  • **Movement Action:** Move up to your SPEED.
  • **Attack of Opportunity (Reaction):** Attack an enemy who voluntarily leaves your melee range.
  • **Disengage (Action):** Move up to half your SPEED without provoking attacks.
  • **Forced Movement:** **Push** (away), **Pull** (toward), **Lift** (up), **Crush** (push into a wall for extra damage).
